citation.article-title: Ramlibacter tataouinensis gen. nov., sp. nov., and Ramlibacter henchirensis sp. nov., cyst-producing bacteria isolated from subdesert soil in Tunisia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ramlibacter tataouinensis sp. nov.
Ramlibacter tataouinensis (ta.ta.oui.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. tataouinensis pertaining to Tataouine, Tunisia).
Ramlibacter tataouinensis has all the characteristics of the genus Ramlibacter.
Aerobic chemo-organotrophic growth by oxidizing acetate, pyruvate, β-hydroxybutyrate, γ-hydroxybutyrate, dl-lactate and propionate.
None of the other substrates in Biolog GN or GP microplates are oxidized.
Negative for gelatin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase activity.
Optimal pH and temperature for growth: 7·5 and 30 °C.
The DNA G+C content is 69·6 mol%.
The type strain is TTB310T (=DSM 14655T =ATCC BAA-407T =LMG 21543T).
